code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:60 yr old white M lead worker presents via EMS a short time following MVA. he was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the front of the head (LOC 11 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 15 mph on impact. pt c/o moderate nausea, mild vomiting, severe headache and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 74 in, Weight 157 lbs, Temperature 98.5 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 17, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:60 year old m lead worker presents for recheck following traumatic incident. he was seen in local EMD for injuries, including a concussion (11 min LOC). he reports doing fine with no problems and denies nausea, vomiting and headache describes drinking an average of 12 beers a week for about 10 days in his past Patient does not smoke o:Height 73 in, Weight 153 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 104, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 16, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=97,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=43.0,Reaction Time=0.49, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

his past Patient does not smoke
No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex ,

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination
